body_html:
If I'm not mistaken that seems to be a problem related to overflows. You can change line containing the computation of self._prior_probs[shard_id] by: self._prior_probs[shard_id] = math_ops.reduce_logsumexp( self._probs[shard_id], axis=1, keep_dims=True) which is numerically stable. I am making some other changes to the code and that will be updated when released. Thanks 2017-03-09 1:51 GMT-05:00 agarwal-ashish <notifications@github.com>:
…
This error looks related to GPU. We have not tested GMM support on GPU. Can you try to force this on cpu ? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#7784 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AEVsoZuKkpr7zG5m7YPNjhNqtfHonSWFks5rj6FdgaJpZM4MI6E5> .
-- Xavi.
body_text:
If I'm not mistaken that seems to be a problem related to overflows.

You can change line containing the computation
of self._prior_probs[shard_id] by:

self._prior_probs[shard_id] = math_ops.reduce_logsumexp(
    self._probs[shard_id], axis=1, keep_dims=True)

which is numerically stable.

I am making some other changes to the code and that will be updated when
released.

Thanks



2017-03-09 1:51 GMT-05:00 agarwal-ashish <notifications@github.com>:

 This error looks related to GPU. We have not tested GMM support on GPU.
 Can you try to force this on cpu ?

body:
If I'm not mistaken that seems to be a problem related to overflows.

You can change line containing the computation
of self._prior_probs[shard_id] by:

self._prior_probs[shard_id] = math_ops.reduce_logsumexp(
    self._probs[shard_id], axis=1, keep_dims=True)

which is numerically stable.

I am making some other changes to the code and that will be updated when
released.

Thanks



2017-03-09 1:51 GMT-05:00 agarwal-ashish <notifications@github.com>:
